list_definition.definition: to come or bring together again

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The general tried to rally his troops after the defeat
The troops rallied round the general.

list_definition.definition: to come or bring together for a joint action or effort

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The supporters rallied to save the club from collapse
The politician asked his supporters to rally to the cause.

list_definition.definition: to (cause to) recover health or strength
a usually large gathering of people for some purpose

list_definition.mean_english: cuộc thi lái xe đường trường
list_definition.definition: a meeting (usually of cars or motorcycles) for a competition, race etc
an improvement in health after an illness.

list_definition.mean_english: loạt đánh trả trong thể thao
list_definition.definition: (in tennis etc) a (usually long) series of shots before the point is won or lost

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They played out a thrilling rally in the second set.
